fullText: It’s far from the first time Ibsen — and this work in particular — has been dragged into the present, but it’s urgent and effective. Ultimately one of the key strengths of this bracing revival is that it presents a classic drama as a play for our time.
bwwExcerpt: Unlike the lavish 1997 National Theatre production starring Ian McKellen, this staging is on the minimal side, with an effective revolving turntable set and a relatively small cast in which the understudies also play the townspeople in the pivotal climactic town hall meeting scene. Howard Shapiro, Philadelphia Inquirer: I couldn't help but think of an ATF agent named Peter Forcelli while I watched the super-charged Broadway revival of An Enemy of the People, Henrik Ibsen's play about a man who t

keyPhrases.quote: presents a classic drama as a play for our time

llmScore.reasoning: Claude: The critic uses strong positive language like 'urgent and effective' and 'bracing revival' to describe this Ibsen production, clearly endorsing it as relevant and well-executed for contemporary audiences. | GPT-4o-mini: The review expresses strong approval of the revival's relevance and effectiveness, indicating a solid recommendation despite not detailing specific elements.
